data.title: Meet Your Alumni Society Executive Committee
data.text:
Dr. Chanin graduated from University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine in 1983 and was the chief dental resident at Newark Beth Israel Medical Center in Newark, NJ. Dr. Chanin then became a partner in Hamilton Dental Associates, a multi-specialty group practice in NJ for 33 years. When he retired from Hamilton Dental Associates, he founded Diamond Dental Associates in Flemington, NJ, focusing on cosmetic dentistry as well as family dentistry. He is a Fellow of the Academy of General Dentistry, a Fellow of the American Society of Dental Aesthetics, a Fellow of the International College of Dentists, a Fellow of the International Academy of Dento-Facial Esthetics, on staff at Newark Beth Israel Medical Center and a clinical Associate of Restorative Dentistry at University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine and Vice President of the Penn Alumni Society. Dr. Chanin is married to Susan, has two children and lives in Titusville, New Jersey.

Flemington, NJ

Click here to connect.

Born into a family of medical professionals in Jackson, Mississippi, Dr. Alani grew up primarily in the Middle East. She completed dental school there in 2001 before returning to the United States. Dr. Alani then received her DMD from Penn Dental Medicine in 2013, graduating with both clinical and research honors. She was also the recipient of the Delta Dental Student Leadership Award and the Dr. Earle Banks Hoyte Teaching Award.

Dr. Alani and her husband, Dr. Wesam Alani (D’13), operate Alani Dental Center in Chattanooga, TN

Chattanooga, TN

Click here to connect.

Dr. Pamela Alberto earned her D.M.D. from the University of Pennsylvania, School of Dental Medicine and her specialty certificate in Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery from the University of Medicine and Dentistry of New Jersey –University Hospital. Dr. Alberto is a Clinical Associate Professor in the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at Rutgers School of Dental Medicine. Formerly, she wasthe Assistant Dean of Predoctoral Education in the office of Academic affairs andthe Director of Predoctoral Surgery in the Department of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery.She is a Fellow in the American Association of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery, the American College of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery the Academy of Dentistry International,the International College of Dentistry, and the American College of Dentist. She is a member of the International Society of Plastics, Anesthetics and Reconstructive Surgery. She has lectured nationally and internationally on oral surgery,implant surgery, alternative medicine local anesthesia and enteral sedation. Dr. Alberto also started Cheerful Heart Missions, which sends groups of dentists and dental students to Haiti and the Dominican Republic each year to provide oral care to hundreds of patients who would otherwise go without.

Sparta, NJ

Click here to connect.

Dr. Doshi was born and raised in upstate New York and attended college at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute where he graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology. He then earned his DMD from the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine. While at Penn, Dr. Doshi received numerous awards and accolades including induction into the Matthew Cryer Honor Society and the Omicron Kappa Upsilon Honor Society. Dr. Doshi next completed his residency in Orthodontics and Dentofacial Orthopedics at Tufts University School of Dental Medicine where he served as Class President and was awarded the Dr. Edward G. Austin Scholarship. During his residency, he focused his research on using 3-D CBCT scans to evaluate the effects of maxillary palatal expansion. He currently has a private practice in Elmhurst, IL and is excited to contribute to the Alumni Society Executive Committee.

Elmhurst, IL

Click here to connect.

A 1984 graduate of Penn Dental Medicine, Dr. Dunoff completed a General Practice Residency Program at the Virtua Health System (West Jersey Health) in Camden, New Jersey in 1985. Licensed to practice Dentistry in the State of New Jersey and the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania, he pursued his initial practice location as a start-up venture in Winslow Township, New Jersey. Four years later, he acquired a second practice in Pleasantville, New Jersey which was later sold. The initial practice was relocated to Berlin, New Jersey; and currently he has acquired a practice in Swedesboro, New Jersey.

Dr. Dunoff is a member of many professional organizations including the American Dental Association, New Jersey Dental Association, American Society for Geriatric Dentistry Board of Directors, Special Care Dentistry Association, and the Academy of General Dentistry. He has hospital affiliations at Our Lady of Lourdes Medical Center and Virtua Health System. He has a clinical appointment as Associate Professor at Penn Dental Medicine where he teaches restorative dentistry. He has been a consultant to the insurance industry with Bravo-ElderHealth Plans and Prizm Solutions and currently is dental consultant to many long-term care nursing facilities. Concurrently with the start-up of his private practice Dr. Dunoff founded a mobile dental service that provides on-site care to many skilled nursing facilities. He is also dental director for CFG Health Systems Correctional Care Division.

Swedesboro, NJ

Click here to connect.

Caryn Siegel is thrilled to be a member of the Alumni Society Executive Committee. Born and raised in New York City, Caryn attended the University of Pennsylvania for both her undergraduate and dental degrees. In 2001, she completed her residency in pediatric dentistry at Boston Children’s Hospital and Harvard School of Dental Medicine. She has been practicing pediatric dentistry on the Upper East Side of New York City since 2001, first as an associate dentist and, since 2009, as one of the partner dentists at NY Kids Dentistry and Orthodontics. In 2011, Caryn began volunteering her time as an attending dentist at Columbia School of Dental Medicine, working in the pediatric dental residency program. She truly enjoys teaching and educating the pediatric dental residents and molding them into future practitioners. Caryn loves treating children and adolescents and takes great pride in the positive impact she makes on the lives of the families she treats. She currently lives in Long Island City with her husband, son Jake and dog Buddy.

New York, NY

Click here to connect.

It is an honor for Dr. Maria Perno Goldie to have been selected to serve on the University of Pennsylvania, School of Dental Medicine, Alumni Society Executive Committee. The dental hygiene program at Penn that she and over 1600 others completed, is now gone. There are many who wish to keep the spirit of dental hygiene alive at Penn, by encouraging scholarship, research, community service, and prevention in oral health.As dental hygiene alum, Dr. Goldie wishes to engage in common goals such as health promotion, disease prevention, improving access to care, and advancing evidence-based practice with the dental alumni. She wishes to support and promote the Dental Hygiene Research and Innovation Fund, which has been established to support one or more dental hygiene (DH) scholars. She would also like to promote the Penn Dental Medicine Dental Hygiene Alumni Association and the Dental Hygiene Alumni Special Achievement Award, which is presented annually and recognizes the outstanding contributions of dental hygiene alumni to the growth and development of the profession. She will do these things through social media, and reaching out personally to the alumni that she knows. Dr. Goldie believe that if we all reach out, and “each one touches one”, we can continue to have an active and robust Dental Hygiene Alumni Society.

San Carlos, CA

Click here to connect.

Dr. Henry is an Assistant Professor of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery at the Boston University Henry M. Goldman School of Dental Medicine (GSDM). Dr. Henry completed his undergraduate studies at the University of Dayton and then attended dental school, medical school and OMFS residency at the University of Pennsylvania in Philadelphia. A 2019 graduate from the prestigious Orthognathic and TMJ Surgery fellowship in Charlotte, NC where he was working under the tutelage of Dr. Brian Farrell and partners at Carolinas Center for Oral and Facial Surgery. Dr. Henry has established a practice centered around orthognathic surgery (and surgical treatment of obstructive sleep apnea) and temporomandibular joints surgery. He has the ability to treat internal derangements via holmium-yag laser assisted arthroscopy as well as the treatment of various arthiritides via arthroscopic or open approaches, including arthroplasty and total joint replacements. He is also well versed in reconstruction in the form of complex bone grafting and secondary facial trauma repair.

Dr. Henry has research interests in improved outcomes following orthognathic surgery, facial trauma epidemiology, reconstruction of the temporomandibular joint and emerging technologies in oral and maxillofacial surgery. He is currently a reviewer for both the Journal of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery as well as the Journal of Cranio-Maxillo-Facial Surgery. He is a Diplomate of the American Board of Oral and Maxillofacial Surgery. In his role of Associate Director of Residency Training Dr. Henry has revised the resident lecture schedule and created a lab simulation curriculum to train the residents in medical and airway emergencies.

Dr. Henry grew up on a farm in Perrysburg, Ohio where his family still resides. In his free time he enjoys cycling, skiing, hiking, fishing, and playing the guitar.

Boston, MA

Click here to connect.

Dr. Kenneth Ingber has been serving the needs of the Washington, D.C. area general dentistry patients at Ingber Dental since 1971 and continues to offer leading-edge dental care. A proud member of the Penn Dental Class of 1971, Dr. Ingber also served as a member of the PDM faculty from 1971 – 1994. For his skill and expertise, Dr. Ingber was appointed as the director of University of Pennsylvania Extramural Department of Continuing Dental Education Program for the Metropolitan Washington, D.C. area and was the editor of the Journal of the District of Columbia Dental Society. Currently, he serves as the director of the International Team of Implantology (ITI) Study Club in the D.C. area. He is an active participant in research with the NIH suppported National Dental Practice-Based Research Network.

Washington, DC

Click here to connect.

Dr. Kracke graduated dental school in ’17 and Orthodontic Residency in ’19 from Penn. He hopes to bring a young alumni perspective and plans to continue communications with young alumni and increase interactions between these new dentists as they enter the workforce. In recent years, he helped to organize the Match Day celebration and feels this is a critical time for the Alumni Board to get connected with new members and then continue to strengthen that relationship as they move on in their early careers. He is excited for the plans the Alumni board has for the future and is grateful to have this opportunity.

Sicklerville, NJ

Click here to connect.

Born in Washington, D.C. and raised in Roslyn, New York, Dr. Daniel Kubikian majored in Pharmacy at St. John’s University in New York. In 2001, he received the Doctor of Dental Medicine degree (DMD) from the School of Dental Medicine at The University of Pennsylvania, in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Dr. Kubikian continued his studies completing a 4-year post-graduate program in Periodontics and Periodontal Prosthesis while earning the Chairman’s Award, from The University of Pennsylvania. Dr. Kubikian is board certified as a Diplomate of the American Board of Periodontology and is an Assistant Clinical Professor in Department of Periodontics at The University of Pennsylvania. He is a featured lecturer in implant dentistry at The University of Pennsylvania and Albert Einstein Medical Center. He has lectured at the Greater New York Dental Meeting and at various meetings throughout the east coast. Since 2007, Dr. Kubikian has taught a comprehensive implant course accredited by the New Jersey Dental Association which is geared to provide state of the art implant education to the dental community. In 2008, Dr. Kubikian founded the South Jersey Dental Study Club which meets monthly and provides continuing education lectures to the dental community from prominent national and international lecturers. Outside of dentistry, Dr. Kubikian spends time with his wife and three daughters. He is an avid sports fan and enjoys baseball, basketball and football.

Sewell, NJ

Click here to connect.

As a recent graduate of the Penn Dental Medicine class of 2019, Dr. Bret Lesavoy is honored to be a member of the Alumni Executive Board and looks forward to contributing to the betterment of Penn Dental Medicine’s already amazing institution. Most of all, he is eager to stay connected with the Penn Dental Medicine student body experience to help ensure students and alumni realize the full potential of PDM, both throughout dental school and beyond.

Upon graduating in 2019, Bret moved onto Columbia University where he completed his residency program in Pediatric Dentistry. Bret is back in Philadelphia working as a pediatric dentist with Cobblestone Kids Pediatric Dentistry and looks forward to continuing his efforts as an active member of the PDM alumni community.

Philadelphia, PA

Click here to connect.

Dr. Schildhorn has many reasons to be involvedat the University of Penn Dental Alumni. She graduated in 1975 from the Penn Dental Hygiene Program. She benefited from an extraordinary program that taught dental hygienists to work with educators, dentists and periodontists. Her trajectory led her to owning a dental employment business,( DENTAL POWER) , a Master’s in Organizational Change, Chairman of Kids Smiles, Inc ( a local not for profit dental service provider), and ultimately the Executive Director to the PA Coalition for Oral Health. In retirement, she is actively involved in helping others learn about the oral health workforce and alternate oral health delivery models. She is excited to be a mentor !

Wynnewood, PA

Click here to connect.

After graduating in 2012, Dr. Sones knew he wanted to find a way to give back to Penn Dental Medicine. Joining the Alumni Board was a great opportunity for him to stay connected and volunteer his services to the University that gave him an education second to none. He also wanted to find a way to help students develop a positive outlook throughout their education at Penn. As a student, he often wondered what things would be like after graduating. As a member of the alumni board, his goal was to help students navigate the transition from dental school, to residency, and ultimately in to private. Being a member of the Alumni Board has given him the opportunity to be connected to Penn and thus far has been very rewarding for him.

Toms River, NJ

Click here to connect.

Ann Eshenaur Spolarich graduated from Penn Dental Hygiene in 1982 and received her baccalaureate degree in dental hygiene from Thomas Jefferson University, and both a master of science degree in dental hygiene and a doctoral degree in physiology from the University of Maryland at Baltimore. She is an internationally recognized author and speaker on pharmacology and the care of medically complex patients. She haspresentedover 1,000 invited lectures and has over 125 professional publications. She is Professor, Course Director of Clinical Medicine and Pharmacology, and Director of Research at the Arizona School of Dentistry & Oral Health, A.T. Still University(ATSU), where she teaches part-time in the Special Care Clinic. Ann is also a faculty member in the NYU Langone AEGD residency program at ATSU. Ann was awarded fellowship status in special care dental hygiene from the Special Care Dentistry Association in 2016.

Mesa, AZ

Click here to connect.

Dr. Wegman has enjoyed his dental career thus far with the Wegman Dental Group, PC, which was formed by Dr. Wegman, Harold C. Wegman, DDS (SDM ‘53) and Gary S. Wegman, DMD (SDM ‘83), since graduating Penn Dental in 1983. Through this business, he has throroughly enjoyed his practice of General Dentistry in Reading, Pa., and his relationship with his team, his patients, and his community. He has served as a representative to the PDA and the ADA in a variety of leadership roles, and presently is running for the US Congress in the 9th District in Pennsylvania. The degree of excellence that his mentors at Penn Dental instilled in his work ethic has carried on throughout his entire career. Staying involved with education and by being connected through the Alumni Society Board with Penn SDM has allowed him to continue this experience with his Penn colleagues.

Reading, PA

Click here to connect.

A native of Philadelphia, Dr. Brigitte White received her dental degree from the University of Pennsylvania School of Dental Medicine after completing her undergraduate education at Princeton University, where she majored in public policy and international affairs. She enjoys mentoring dental students as a Penn Dental clinical instructor in the Department of Restorative Dentistry.

Dr. Brigitte White is a passionate healthcare provider committed to helping patients achieve their smile goals. As a cosmetic and restorative dentist, she offers solutions for family members of all ages from newborn oral care regimens to treatments for aging patients looking for comprehensive smile rehabilitation. Her years of experience in entertainment and intellectual property add to her high regard for dental esthetic value as well as product safety and efficacy in the oral care market. In addition to her role in the clinic, Dr. White is a published author and blogger. Through her writing, she shares inspirational smile tips for all parts of life as an entrepreneur, mother, and doctor of dental medicine. Furthermore, she is the creator of SmileSpruce, a personalized oral beauty guide to up your smile game.

In practice for fifteen years, Dr. White has experience in private practice, public health, and also worked as a provider for the U.S. Army in Germany. She currently provides care at her solo practice BrightWhites Dental in Northern, Virginia. Always a student of science discovery, Dr. White published research on Olfaction and Gustatory Function in the Annals of Neurology. In her free time, she enjoys traveling with her family and writing. She is the author of the young adult fiction novel All-American as well as a collection of Oral Care Children’s Books, which are available on Amazon. Follow her across social media @drbrigittewhite.

Alexandria, VA

Click here to connect.
